intelligentMarkingDesc.message: Automatically grade subjective questions in assignments and exams.

intelligentMarkingHint.message: Note: Intelligent marking is only applicable to individual assignments scored by teachers and quizzes/exams containing short-answer questions. Moreover, AI marking is limited to text content and does not currently support marking attachments, pictures, and other non-text content submitted by students.

studentPeerReview.message: Peer review assignments do not support smart grading

systemScoring.message: System-grading (auto-grading) assignments do not support smart grading

topicRequirementTip.message: To improve the accuracy of smart grading, you can make fine adjustments to the question/assignment requirements. The adjustment will only take effect on this grading content and will not affect the original question/assignment content.

referenceAnswerTip.message: To improve the accuracy of smart grading, you can choose to grade based on the reference answer. You can manually adjust the answer content. The adjustment will only take effect on this grading content and will not affect the original reference answer.

noIntelligentMarkingData.message: No data found for smart grading

randomPaper.message: Random exams do not support smart grading

gradingTestHint.message: Note: The results of the grading testing will not be saved. If you are sure that the grading results are as expected, you can choose to start grading.

selectWorkQueError.message: Select the question/assignment to be graded

startScoringHint.message:
After the grading starts, the system will grade the answer submitted by the students according to the grading rules (it will not affect the scores of students that the teacher has already marked).
Are you sure you want to start grading?

scoringInProgressHint.message:
Grading in progress...

The grading process may take a long time. You can choose to close the pop-up window and the system will continue to grade in the background.

remainingScoreError.message: The sum of all criterion points must equal the total possible

scoringItemLengthError.message: Grading Item {index} must be between 2 and 500 characters

scoringItemLengthError1.message: Criterion {subIndex} of Grading Item {index} must be between 2 and 500 characters

scoringMetricsAndScoreError.message: The points of Criterion {subIndex} under Grading Item {index} cannot be empty

maxScoringItemError.message: A maximum of 10 grading items can be added to a rubric

maxMetricError.message: A maximum of 10 criteria can be added to one grading item

scoreNumberError.message: The value of points can only be a number

scoreNegativeError.message: The value of points cannot be less than 0

scoreDecimalError.message: The value of points can only be one decimal place

essayScoringTopicMetrics.message: Based on the content analysis and question requirements, the student's answer has clear themes, closely follow the central idea of ​​the content, has accurate arguments, and fully meet the requirements of the question.

essayScoringStructureMetrics.message: The student's answers has a clear, rigorous, and leveled logical structure.

essayScoringLanguageMetrics.message: The student's language expression is clear and fluent, with correct grammar, appropriate wording, and the number of words meets the requirements.

shortAnswerContentMetrics.message: The student's answer was comprehensive and accurately covered all the key points required by the question.

shortAnswerAccuracyMetrics.message: The opinions, facts or data are accurate and there is no misinterpretation.

studentAnalysisAndTextbook.message: Analysis of Learning Situation and Instructional Materials

teachingGoalsMetrics.message: The objectives are clearly defined and specific, embodying the integration of core subject competencies/three-dimensional goals (knowledge & skills, process & methods, emotional attitudes & values), aligned with curriculum standards and student realities, while addressing both holistic development and individual needs.

studentAnalysisAndTextbookMetrics.message: Accurately assess students' prior knowledge, competency levels, and learning characteristics to anticipate challenges and develop targeted instructional strategies. • Clearly articulate the textbook's role, knowledge structure, and alignment with curriculum standards while ensuring pedagogically sound content delivery.

teachingContentMetrics.message: The knowledge components are scientifically structured and comprehensive, with clearly emphasized key points and identified difficult concepts. The selected instructional materials are student-centered, balancing foundational knowledge with expansion opportunities, while authentically reflecting disciplinary thinking methods.

teachingMethodsAndMeansMetrics.message: The methodology aligns with disciplinary characteristics and student cognition, emphasizing heuristic inquiry. The instructional tools (teaching aids, technologies, etc.) are employed appropriately to effectively address key points and overcome difficulties.

sessionDesignMetrics.message: Lesson Stage Design: The instructional sequence (warm-up/introduction, new content presentation, practice, and summary) is complete, logically coherent, and temporally well-proportioned.

studentParticipationMetrics.message: Student Engagement: Emphasizes learner-centeredness, incorporates interactive inquiry activities, provides timely feedback and assessment, and effectively balances planned instruction with emergent learning opportunities.

abilityTrainingMetrics.message: Competency Development: Focuses on cultivating disciplinary thinking and learning strategies, while making visible the knowledge construction process.

homeworkAndBlackboardMetrics.message: Assignment Design: Features tiered assignments with appropriate volume and varied formats, directly aligned with instructional objectives. • Whiteboard writing clearly presents knowledge frameworks, while lesson summaries concisely review key points and prompt reflection.

innovationAndLiteracyMetrics.message: Instructional Design: Demonstrates innovation while embodying curriculum philosophy; Teacher Presence: Exhibits natural demeanor with strong professional competencies (e.g., articulation, demonstration).

videoAnalysisLongTimeTip.message: Video analysis is in progress. You may close this page and check the results later in the history records.
